summary: Eric Starvo Galt is an alias used by James Earl Ray, the suspected assassin of Martin Luther King Jr. The documents primarily focus on the immediate aftermath of King's assassination in April 1968, detailing efforts to locate and identify Galt/Ray. CIA cables were disseminated worldwide to gather information and request assistance in his apprehension. The CIA's involvement was at the request of the FBI, with efforts focused on gathering information on Ray's aliases and whereabouts through overseas liaison services. The documents highlight the urgency and international scope of the search for Galt/Ray following the assassination.
significance: While the documents primarily relate to the assassination of Martin Luther King Jr., one document mentions investigations into the assassinations of both Martin Luther King Jr. and President John F. Kennedy, placing Eric Starvo Galt (James Earl Ray) tangentially within the broader context of assassination investigations during that period. However, the documents do not directly implicate Galt/Ray in the JFK assassination.
